usa: Carrollton bus collision: A drunk driver crashed into a church bus near Carrollton, Kentucky, killing twenty-seven people.[544]
The Yellowstone fires of 1988 burned 793,880 acres of Yellowstone National Park.[545]
Wrigley Field in Chicago, Illinois added lights for night games, being the last major league park that didn't have lights.<sup id="cite_ref-546" class="reference">[546]</sup>

The Civil Liberties Act, compensating Japanese Americans who "lost liberty or property because of discriminatory action by the Federal government during World War II", was signed into law.<sup id="cite_ref-547" class="reference">[547]</sup>
STS-41-D: The Space Shuttle Discovery was launched.[548]
Morris worm, the first computer worm distributed via the Internet, was launched.[549]
U.S. presidential election, 1988: Vice President George H. W. Bush was elected President, defeating Massachusetts Governor Michael Dukakis.[550]
The regularly scheduled Pan Am Flight 103 from Frankfurt to Detroit was destroyed by a bomb, killing all 243 passengers and 16 crew, and 11 people on the ground.[551]
